DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to find out whether labeling adults with prehypertension has negative effects on clinic blood pressure and quality of life 3 months after diagnosis.
DOC.criteria: at least 18 years average screening systolic blood pressure of 120139 mmHg OR diastolic blood pressure of 8089 mmHg average screening systolic blood pressure below 140 mmHg AND diastolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg able to read and write in English past diagnosis of hypertension, prehypertension, or high blood pressure current or past use of antihypertensive medications diabetes renal disease cardiovascular disease current participation in another hypertensionrelated clinical trial
